intro: Octomeria rohrii, commonly known as the Rohri's octomeria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentamerous flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or arid conditions, and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruit type. Octomeria rohrii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
